cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 105 mi SSE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly moving north-northwest, expected to bend northwest and then north, crossing the South/North Carolina coast Sunday and then lifting north-northeast inland across the Mid-Atlantic before re-emerging offshore early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast between Myrtle Beach, SC and Cape Fear, NC

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to south of South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Carolina through eastern North Carolina with later impacts spreading into the Mid-Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Low (4%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible Mondayâ€“Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along New York/New Jersey coast from ANA.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of light to moderate rain possible late Monday into Tuesday as remnants pass offshore.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells and hazardous rip currents may affect approaches and pilot boarding areas.
